div1.p: [Gorgas] writes about political maneuverings for staff appointments and promotions, and recognition for James Carroll.

div1.head: Letter fragment from [William Crawford Gorgas] to Jefferson Randolph Kean, September 17, 1906

opener.dateline:
ISTHMIAN CANAL ZONE
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH
____
OFFICE OF CHIEF SANITARY OFFICER
ANCON, C. Z.
September 17th 1906.

div1.p:
To continue my letter of
the other day. I also would like
to see this work remain in the hands
of our corps, but I do not think
that I should let this outweigh
justice to the friends who stood
by me when I had very few
friends down here. Carter &
Perry both stood by me faith-
fully when about every body
else was against me & all felt
sure that I was to be removed
they were both recommended
for removal on that account
at the same time that Shouts &
the Secretary made the recom-
2
mendation for my removal, June
1905. I do not see how I can take
any part in having them passed
over by men who have come in
when the battle has been won.

If change comes I will recom-
mend that Phillips come in after
Carter. Perry is entirely satisfied
with his present position, I of
course see that it will not do
to promote entirely by service on the
Isthmus, as with course of time
this would entirely eliminate ser-
vice men. And I expect to make
my recommendations with the
view of getting Army men in these
places. But I doubt if I can
altogether stand against Riley
& Fryman in such a matter.

Riley has written me about
having some one of the older negro
3
men come down in Ross place &
when White of the P. U. L M. U. S. heard
that Carter had dysentery he wrote
that he would like to come.

Riley is close to the President &
Lyman to Congress. Gen. O Reillys
hard work with [?] in my
favor last spring of 189 1905 would not
have saved me. Taft joined
Shouts in his recommendation
in spite of it. The President in-
sisted upon giving me a further
chance. Lambert & Riley had
both seen him upon the subject
I think Lambert was the man who
had most weight.

I mention this to show you &
O'Reilly that all my sailing
is not smooth down here.

I doubt if you & I can agree
with regard to the credit due Finlay
& Carter. No one questions that
